1718                instance.familyLean = new TextFamily().defaultFamilyLeanDistance();
1719            } catch (Exception e) {
1720                e.printStackTrace();
1721            }
1722        }
1723        if(instance.familyLean != null)
1724            return instance.familyLean.copy();
1725        return null;
1726    }
1727    /**
1728     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a fixed-width font with good Unicode support and a traditional
1729     * serif style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes and supports 4 styles (regular, bold, italic,
1730     * and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Go Mono, a typeface released by the team
1731     * behind the Go programming language as open-source (3-clause BSD, the same license as the Go language; the license
1732     * is included with the assets). It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and
1733     * Cyrillic, bu also the necessary box drawing characters (which line up even for italic text). There's more
1734     * information about this font available where it was introduced,
1735     * <a href="https://blog.golang.org/go-fonts">on the Go blog</a>.
1736     * You may want to try using this Go font family and contrasting it with Iosevka with and without slab serifs, which
1737     * are {@link #getSlabFamily()} and {@link #getLeanFamily()} respectively.
1738     * <br>
1739     * <br>
1740     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1741     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1742     * <br>
1743     * Needs files:
1744     * <ul>
1745     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/GoMono-Family-distance.fnt</li>
1746     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/GoMono-Family-distance.png</li>
1747     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/GoMono-License.txt</li>
1748     * </ul>
1749     * @return the TextFamily object that can represent many sizes of the font GoMono.ttf with 4 styles
1750     */
1751    public static TextFamily getGoFamily()
1752    {
1753        initialize();
1754        if(instance.familyGo == null)
1755        {
1756            try {
1757                instance.familyGo = new TextFamily();
1758                instance.familyGo.fontDistanceField("GoMono-Family-distance.fnt", "GoMono-Family-distance.png");
1759            } catch (Exception e) {
1760                e.printStackTrace();
1761            }
1762        }
1763        if(instance.familyGo != null)
1764            return instance.familyGo.copy();
1765        return null;
1766    }
1767    /**
1768     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support and a
1769     * sans-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes (using an MSDF technique) and supports 4
1770     * styles (regular, bold, italic, and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Iosevka, an
1771     * open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it 
1772     * uses several customizations thanks to Iosevka's special build process, applied to the 4 styles. It supports a lot
1773     * of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also circled letters and digits and
1774     * the necessary box drawing characters (which line up even for italic text). The high glyph count means the texture
1775     * that holds all four faces of the font is larger than normal, at 4096x4096; this may be too large for some devices
1776     * to load correctly (mostly older phones or tablets). A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some
1777     * approximate multiple of that aspect ratio); this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using
1778     * Viewports.  This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed
1779     * Distance Field technique, which gives the rendered font sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips
1780     * on strokes. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a true typography expert) called Iosevka
1781     * <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that deserves an award."</a> You may want to
1782     * try using both this version of Iosevka without serifs and the other version SquidLib has with an MSDF effect, 
1783     * {@link #getCrispSlabFamily()}.
1784     * <br>
1785     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/dMVzpEi.png">image link</a>, with bold at the bottom.
1786     * <br>
1787     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1788     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1789     * <br>
1790     * Needs files:
1791     * <ul>
1792     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Family-msdf.fnt</li>
1793     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Family-msdf.png</li>
1794     * </ul>
1795     * @return the TextFamily object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka.ttf with 4 styles and an MSDF effect
1796     */
1797    public static TextFamily getCrispLeanFamily()
1798    {
1799        initialize();
1800        if(instance.familyLeanMSDF == null)
1801        {
1802            try {
1803                instance.familyLeanMSDF = new TextFamily();
1804                instance.familyLeanMSDF.fontMultiDistanceField("Iosevka-Family-msdf.fnt", "Iosevka-Family-msdf.png");
1805            } catch (Exception e) {
1806                e.printStackTrace();
1807            }
1808        }
1809        if(instance.familyLeanMSDF != null)
1810            return instance.familyLeanMSDF.copy();
1811        return null;
1812
1813    }
1814
1815    /**
1816     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support and a
1817     * slab-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes (using an MSDF technique) and supports 4
1818     * styles (regular, bold, italic, and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Iosevka with
1819     * slab style, an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see
1820     * https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations thanks to Iosevka's special build
1821     * process, applied to the 4 styles. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek,
1822     * and Cyrillic, but also circled letters and digits and the necessary box drawing characters (which line up even 
1823     * for italic text). The high glyph count means the texture that holds all four faces of the font is larger than
1824     * normal, at 4096x4096; this may be too large for some devices to load correctly (mostly older phones or tablets).
1825     * A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate multiple of that aspect ratio); this
1826     * allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports.  This uses the Multi-channel Signed
1827     * Distance Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed  Distance Field technique, which gives the
1828     * rendered font sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips on strokes. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a
1829     * true typography expert) called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that
1830     * deserves an award."</a> You may want to try using both this version of Iosevka with slab serifs and the other
1831     * version SquidLib has with an MSDF effect, {@link #getCrispLeanFamily()}.
1832     * <br>
1833     * This TextFamily has its smoothing multiplier set to 1.55 instead of the default 1.2, which helps it stay sharp.
1834     * <br>
1835     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/wRNlpL5.png">image link</a>, with bold at the bottom.
1836     * <br>
1837     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1838     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1839     * <br>
1840     * Needs files:
1841     * <ul>
1842     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Family-msdf.fnt</li>
1843     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Family-msdf.png</li>
1844     * </ul>
1845     * @return the TextFamily object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka-Slab.ttf with 4 styles and an MSDF effect
1846     */
1847    public static TextFamily getCrispSlabFamily()
1848    {
1849        initialize();
1850        if(instance.familySlabMSDF == null)
1851        {
1852            try {
1853                instance.familySlabMSDF = new TextFamily();
1854                instance.familySlabMSDF
1855                        .fontMultiDistanceField("Iosevka-Slab-Family-msdf.fnt", "Iosevka-Slab-Family-msdf.png")
1856                        .setSmoothingMultiplier(1.55f);
1857            } catch (Exception e) {
1858                e.printStackTrace();
1859            }
1860        }
1861        if(instance.familySlabMSDF != null)
1862            return instance.familySlabMSDF.copy();
1863        return null;
1864
1865    }
1866    /**
1867     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a variable-width serif font that should look like the serif
1868     * fonts used in many novels' main texts, and that should scale cleanly to many sizes using an MSDF technique, and
1869     * supports 4 styles (regular, bold, italic, and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is 
1870     * Noto Serif, which is OFL-licensed by Google, and looks very legible in normal use. Meant to be used in
1871     * variable-width displays like TextPanel.
1872     * <br>
1873     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/WsDqSfJ.png">In the foreground message box in ZoneDemo</a>
1874     * <br>
1875     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1876     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1877     * <br>
1878     * Needs files:
1879     * <ul>
1880     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/NotoSerif-Family-msdf.fnt</li>
1881     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/NotoSerif-Family-msdf.png</li>
1882     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/NotoSerif-license.txt</li>
1883     * </ul>
1884     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Noto Serif, made available by Google
1885     */
1886    public static TextFamily getCrispPrintFamily() {
1887        initialize();
1888        if (instance.familyPrintMSDF == null) {
1889            try {
1890                instance.familyPrintMSDF = new TextFamily();
1891                instance.familyPrintMSDF.fontMultiDistanceField(crispNotoSerif, crispNotoSerifTexture)
1892                        .width(7).height(30).setSmoothingMultiplier(1.5f);
1893                instance.familyPrintMSDF.font().setUseIntegerPositions(false);
1894            } catch (Exception e) {
1895                e.printStackTrace();
1896            }
1897        }
1898        if(instance.familyPrintMSDF != null)
1899            return instance.familyPrintMSDF.copy();
1900        return null;
1901    }
1902    /**
1903     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a partially-angular variable-width font with good Unicode
1904     * support and an appearance as if it were carved into solid rock, that should scale cleanly to even very large
1905     * sizes (using an MSDF technique). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is
1906     * <a href="https://fontstruct.com/fontstructions/show/507930/bloccus">Bloccus by Christian Munk</a>. It supports a
1907     * lot of glyphs, including most of extended Latin, Greek, Cyrillic, and the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA),
1908     * but not box drawing characters because this is variable-width. This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance
1909     * Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed Distance Field technique, which gives the rendered font
1910     * sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips on strokes.
1911     * <br>
1912     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/zaqgHTW.png">Image link</a>
1913     * <br>
1914     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1915     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.
1916     * <br>
1917     * Needs files:
1918     * <ul>
1919     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/bloccus-msdf.fnt</li>
1920     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/bloccus-msdf.png</li>
1921     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/bloccus-license.txt</li>
1922     * </ul>
1923     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font bloccus.ttf
1924     */
1925    public static TextCellFactory getCrispCarvedFont()
1926    {
1927        initialize();
1928        if(instance.msdfCarved == null)
1929        {
1930            try {
1931                instance.msdfCarved = new TextCellFactory()
1932                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispCarved, crispCarvedTexture)
1933                        .width(32f).height(32f).setSmoothingMultiplier(1.5f);
1934            } catch (Exception e) {
1935                e.printStackTrace();
1936            }
1937        }
1938        if(instance.msdfCarved != null)
1939            return instance.msdfCarved.copy();
1940        return null;
1941    }
1942    /**
1943     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a variable-width sans-serif font with good Unicode support
1944     * and a no-nonsense look, that should scale cleanly to even very large or small sizes (using an MSDF technique).
1945     * Caches the result for later calls. The font used is <a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Roboto">Roboto
1946     * Regular by Christian Robertson</a>. It supports a lot of glyphs, including most Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic,
1947     * but not box drawing characters because this is variable-width. This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance
1948     * Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed Distance Field technique, which gives the rendered font
1949     * sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips on strokes.
1950     * <br>
1951     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/ASjdjc6.png">Image link when scaled to a small size</a>
1952     * <br>
1953     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1954     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.
1955     * <br>
1956     * Needs files:
1957     * <ul>
1958     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Roboto-Regular-msdf.fnt</li>
1959     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Roboto-Regular-msdf.png</li>
1960     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Roboto-License.txt</li>
1961     * </ul>
1962     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Roboto-Regular.ttf
1963     */
1964    public static TextCellFactory getCrispRobotoSansFont()
1965    {
1966        initialize();
1967        if(instance.msdfRoboto == null)
1968        {
1969            try {
1970                instance.msdfRoboto = new TextCellFactory()
1971                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispRobotoSans, crispRobotoSansTexture)
1972                        .width(3f).height(14f).setSmoothingMultiplier(2f);
1973            } catch (Exception e) {
1974                e.printStackTrace();
1975            }
1976        }
1977        if(instance.msdfRoboto != null)
1978            return instance.msdfRoboto.copy();
1979        return null;
1980    }

1982    /**
1983     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a fixed-width icon font (no letters are supported) using the
1984     * Font-Awesome icon set, that should scale cleanly to even very large sizes. Caches the result for later calls.
1985     * The icon font used is the popular Font-Awesome free set (solid style), an open-source (SIL Open Font License)
1986     * typeface that is often used online. You will probably want to consult the cheatsheet for what chars are actually
1987     * supported; <a href="https://fontawesome.com/cheatsheet">the cheatsheet is here</a>. This uses the Multi-channel
1988     * Signed Distance Field technique as opposed to the normal Signed Distance Field technique, which should allow
1989     * sharper edges. You may also want the list of all chars in this icon font; {@link #iconFontAll} has that.
1990     * <br>
1991     * Preview: <a href="">Image link</a>
1992     * <br>
1993     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1994     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.
1995     * <br>
1996     * Needs files:
1997     * <ul>
1998     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/awesome-solid-msdf.fnt</li>
1999     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/awesome-solid-msdf.png</li>
2000     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Font-Awesome-license.txt</li>
2001     * </ul>
2002     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of Font Awesome Free (solid) with an MSDF effect
2003     */
2004    public static TextCellFactory getCrispIconFont()
2005    {
2006        initialize();
2007        if(instance.msdfIcons == null)
2008        {
2009            try {
2010                instance.msdfIcons = new TextCellFactory()
2011                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispIcons, crispIconsTexture);
2012            } catch (Exception e) {
2013                e.printStackTrace();
2014            }
2015        }
2016        if(instance.msdfIcons != null)
2017            return instance.msdfIcons.copy();
2018        return null;
2019
2020    }

2024    /**
2025     * Gets an image of a (squid-like, for SquidLib) tentacle, 32x32px.
2026     * Source is public domain: http://opengameart.org/content/496-pixel-art-icons-for-medievalfantasy-rpg
2027     * Created by Henrique Lazarini (7Soul1, http://7soul1.deviantart.com/ )
2028     * <br>
2029     * Needs file:
2030     * <ul>
2031     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Tentacle.png</li>
2032     * </ul>
2033     * @return a TextureRegion containing an image of a tentacle.
2034     */
2035    public static TextureRegion getTentacle()
2036    {
2037        initialize();
2038        if(instance.tentacle == null || instance.tentacleRegion == null)
2039        {
2040            try {
2041                instance.tentacle = new Texture(Gdx.files.internal("Tentacle.png"));
2042                instance.tentacleRegion = new TextureRegion(instance.tentacle);
2043            } catch (Exception ignored) {
2044            }
2045        }
2046        return instance.tentacleRegion;
2047    }

2050    /**
2051     * Gets a TextureAtlas containing many icons with a distance field effect applied, allowing them to be used with
2052     * "stretchable" fonts and be resized in the same way. These will not look as-expected if stretchable fonts are not
2053     * in use, and will seem hazy and indistinct if the shader hasn't been set up for a distance field effect by
2054     * TextCellFactory (which stretchable fonts will do automatically). The one page of the TextureAtlas is 2048x2048,
2055     * which may be too large for some old, low-end Android phones, and possibly integrated graphics with fairly old
2056     * processors on desktop. It has over 2000 icons.
2057     * <br>
2058     * The icons are CC-BY and the license is distributed with them, though the icons are not necessarily included with
2059     * SquidLib. If you use the icon atlas, be sure to include icons-license.txt with it and reference it with your
2060     * game's license and/or credits information.
2061     * <br>
2062     * Needs files:
2063     * <ul>
2064     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/icons.atlas</li>
2065     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/icons.png</li>
2066     *     <li>https://github.com/SquidPony/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/icons-license.txt Needed to credit artists</li>
2067     * </ul>
2068     * @return a TextureAtlas containing over 2000 icons with a distance field effect
2069     */
2070    public static TextureAtlas getIconAtlas()
2071    {
2072        initialize();
2073        if(instance.iconAtlas == null)
2074        {
2075            try {
2076                instance.iconAtlas = new TextureAtlas(Gdx.files.internal("icons.atlas"));
2077            } catch (Exception ignored) {
2078            }
2079        }
2080        return instance.iconAtlas;
2081    }

2083    /**
2084     * This is a static global StatefulRNG that's meant for usage in cases where the seed does not matter and any
2085     * changes to this RNG's state will not change behavior elsewhere in the program; this means the GUI mainly.
2086     */
2087    public static StatefulRNG getGuiRandom()
2088    {
2089        initialize();
2090        if(instance.guiRandom == null)
2091        {
2092            instance.guiRandom =  new StatefulRNG();
2093        }
2094        return instance.guiRandom;
2095    }
2096    /**
2097     * This is a static global SquidColorCenter that can be used in places that just need an existing object that can do
2098     * things like analyze hue or saturation of a color.
2099     */
2100    public static SquidColorCenter getSCC()
2101    {
2102        initialize();
2103        if(instance.scc == null)
2104        {
2105            instance.scc =  new SquidColorCenter();
2106        }
2107        return instance.scc;
2108    }

2113    public static final String narrowFontSymbols = "";

2115                                          "456789:;<=>?@ABCDEFG\n" +

2122                                          "\n" +

2126                                          "\n" +
2127                                          "\n" +
2128                                          "\n" +

2137    /**
2138     * All of the Font-Awesome Free (solid style) characters in {@link #getCrispIconFont()}, as a String.
